intro: Nototriche alternata, commonly known as the alternate nototriche, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a flat-topped cluster. Nototriche alternata is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
